alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Latimer; Le Flore; Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 08 at 10:53AM CST until February 09 at 8:51PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in Arkansas, Carroll, Franklin, Madison and Sebastian. In southeast Oklahoma, Choctaw, Latimer, Le Flore and Pushmataha. * WHEN...Until 9 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches with locally higher totals will be possible within the watch area through Wednesday evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
